Comments_List: I learned to look at empirical evaluations of how and whether different countries democratize.

We covered theories of how democracies are formed and why democracies turn more democratic. Overall, I developed a more nuanced and less idealized view of democracy thanks to the readings and discussion in the course.
I had a fantastic time in this class. I learned a great deal about the various theories of democratization as well as how to write a literature review paper on a case study.
I really liked the course! i thought that classes were structured well.
This course was taught extremely well. Professor Svolik was very engaging and the course material was very relevant to current events.
I like the data-based approach the class takes in discussing systems of governments, particularly democracy, that seems to lack in many other classes of the same fields.

Students should take this course if they are interested in understanding democracy better and would like to learn more about how political scientists think and ask questions. The readings are interesting and Prof. Svolik is a great discussion leader.
